p: To check the phytogeographical distribution, its status in Brazil, and the origin of each plant species, we used the Tropical Plant Database [ 52], Missouri Botanical Garden Plant Finder [ 53], GBIF [ 31], PROTA4A [ 54], PROSEA [ 55], Van Andel et al. [ 56], the Flora do Brasil 2020 online checklist [ 32], the Flora of China [ 57], Kew Science Plants of the World online [ 58], the Catalogue of Life Annual Checklist [ 59], Tropicos [ 33], the Naturalis Bioportal [ 60], and Herbarium voucher labels at MG. To compare our results to the VOP ethnobotanical inventory in the 1980s, we updated the taxonomy of the plant species found at the medicinal and religious plant stalls by Van den Berg [ 1] and checked if they were native or introduced. Comparing detailed medicinal or ritual uses of plants between 1984 and 2018 was not part of our research aims.
